page.title: 01Hills south of Grantshouse
page.content: The majority of this block has land over 700 ft with the road running along the foot of the upland ae in the good quality agricultural land. The are is predominated by 5 large farms,all of which utilise the land for farming and forestry.A noticeable feature is the removal of hedgerows and fences to make larger fields for more effective farming techniques, also double the normal width of gates. Despite the presence of various Iron Age archaeology sites on the upper slopes, the area has not developed much and there are no services due to its location close to Abbey StBatrans and Duuns. At the top of Drakemire hill, good views are afforded to the south to the cheriot hills, across the intensiey farmed valley, which contrasts with the new forestry on the margna lands of the upper area.
